intro: Phlomoides chinghoensis, commonly known as the Chinese phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as mountain forests. It features slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its flowers are usually pale blue or purple, arranged in whorls along the stem, and bloom during the summer months.
